Kent,

The @Factory (Runner) annotion looks very useful. It would give, for 
example, a hook to load the test in a custom classloader. This could 
have been done with a decorator in Junit 3.x.

- Neil Swingler

Kent Beck wrote:
<snip>

>  * The class is now annotated with a class used to run it: @Factory(Parameterized.class). This seems like a very general mechanism to me. For example, I was able to write a test runnerlet to run JUnit 3.x AllTests in a few minutes. Would JUnit extenders find this annotation generally helpful?
>  
>
<snip>
